byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: U S Commerce Dept doubts neutrals and USSR reship U S goods to Germany; rept on gains in U S shipments, Sept-Jan
snippet: WASHINGTON, April 1--The interest of the British Government in suspected heavy transshipment of American goods into Germany via neutrals contiguous to Germany caused attention to be devoted by officials here to the possibilities in that connection...

headline.main: WASHINGTON SCANS WAR TRADE RESALE; Findings Discount British Idea of Transshipment to Reich by Contiguous Neutrals PERCENTAGE GAINS LISTED Interpreted as Showing Aim to Offset Blockade Rather Than to Supply Nazis

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 1--The interest of the British Government in suspected heavy transshipment of American goods into Germany via neutrals contiguous to Germany caused attention to be devoted by officials here to the possibilities in that connection.
